caption:
This photograph features a dream-like, surreal composition involving nature and ethereal light effects. In the foreground, silhouettes of plants, possibly flowers or small shrubs, are depicted in a dark setting. The silhouettes are sharp and create an intricate pattern against a softly illuminated backdrop.

The most captivating element is the inclusion of two circular shapes that dominate the center and left side of the image. These shapes resemble moons or orbs of light, and their surfaces are textured, possibly by the effects of multiple exposures or overlays within the photograph. The rightmost larger circle shows streaks and fragmented light patterns, which give it a dynamic, almost fiery appearance, suggesting movement or the play of light on a reflective surface.

The background is predominantly dark, enhancing the luminosity and mystical quality of the light orbs. There appears to be a subtle gradient of light, with the darkest tones at the top gradually transitioning to the lighter tones near the orbs. This setting evokes a feeling of night time or a scene illuminated under low light conditions where these light phenomena stand out dramatically.

Overall, the composition is artistic and atmospheric, filled with a sense of mystery and the beauty of the natural world mingling with abstract light effects.
title: Close-up of moss spore heads growing on an old log in the Hoh River Rain, Olympic National Park, Washington. Near Seattle, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. May, 1974.
